alert.note: Alert for Clark (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 5:01PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wisconsin, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 458 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. An additional inch of rain is expected to fall this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thorp, Loyal, Greenwood, Owen, Longwood, Reseburg, Willard, Withee, Curtiss, Atwood, Mead Lake, Riplinger, The Blue Swamp, Eidsvold and Rock Dam Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
